Wow, I've heard so much about Pok Pok! What type of cuisine do they serve?

Pok Pok is a popular restaurant in Portland, Oregon that serves authentic Thai cuisine. The restaurant's menu is inspired by the bold and complex flavors of Thailand, and many of the dishes are traditional street foods or comfort foods. Some of the most popular dishes at Pok Pok include the famous Fish Sauce Wings, Papaya Salad, Khao Soi, and Issan-style sausages. They offer a unique taste of Thai cuisine that you won't find anywhere else in Portland.
That sounds amazing! I can't wait to try Pok Pok's Fish Sauce Wings. Do you have any other recommendations for dishes I should try there?

Absolutely! Besides the famous Fish Sauce Wings, here are a few other popular dishes at Pok Pok you might want to try:

1. Ike's Vietnamese Fish Sauce Wings - This is a version of the famous Pok Pok Fish Sauce Wings that are marinated with honey, coriander, garlic, and other spices, and then topped with crispy fried garlic and shallots.

2. Papaya Pok Pok - This is the restaurant's signature dish, a tangy and spicy salad made with shredded green papaya, dried shrimp, garlic, chili, peanuts, and fish sauce.

3. Khao Soi - This is a Northern Thai curry noodle soup with a rich, coconut-based broth, topped with crispy egg noodles, pickled mustard greens, and lime.

4. Muu Paa Kham Waan - This is a sweet and sour pork belly dish that is slow-cooked with garlic, cinnamon, and palm sugar until it's melt-in-your-mouth tender.

5. Yam Makheua Yao - This is a salad made with grilled Japanese eggplant, shallots, garlic, chili, fish sauce, lime, and herbs.

All of these dishes are authentic and delicious, and they will give you a great taste of the complex and exciting flavors of Thai cuisine.
Oh my god, my mouth is watering just thinking about all these delicious dishes. I love spicy food, do they have any really spicy dishes at Pok Pok?

Yes! Pok Pok has several dishes that are quite spicy, and they even have a "spice guide" on their menu that indicates the level of spiciness for each dish so you can choose according to your taste. Here are a few dishes that are on the spicier side:

1. Papaya Pok Pok - This salad has a nice kick of spice from the chili peppers and garlic.

2. Khao Soi - This curry noodle soup has a moderate level of spiciness, but you can request it to be spicy if you like.

3. Kung Op Wun Sen - This is a dish of prawns and glass noodles baked with garlic, pepper, and cilantro, and it can be quite spicy.

4. Yam Makheua Yao - This salad made with grilled eggplant, chili, and garlic has a nice level of spice that adds a kick to the sweet and sour flavors.

5. Gai Yang - This is a grilled chicken dish marinated in a turmeric and coriander paste, served with a spicy chili dipping sauce.

If you love spicy food, you'll definitely find something on the Pok Pok menu that suits your taste.
